report.name: lvl0_profiled_time
report.text: Application profile is long enough (12.40 s)
report.desc: To have good quality measurements, it is advised that the application profiling time is greater than 10 seconds.

report.name: lvl0_utilitary_options
report.text: Most of time spent in analyzed modules comes from functions without compilation information
report.desc:
Functions without compilation information (typically not compiled with -g) cumulate 100.00% of the time spent in analyzed modules. Check that -g is present.
Remark: if -g is indeed used, this can also be due to some compiler built-in functions (typically math) or statically linked libraries. This warning can be ignored in that case.

report.name: lvl0_optimization_level
report.text: Optimization level option is correctly used

report.name: lvl0_is_perf_event_paranoid
report.text: Security settings from the host restrict profiling. Some metrics will be missing or incomplete.
report.desc: Current value for kernel.perf_event_paranoid is 2. If possible, set it to 1 or check with your system administrator which flag can be used to achieve this.

report.name: lvl0_architecture_options
report.text: Compilation of some functions is not optimized for the target processor
report.desc: Architecture specific options are needed to produce efficient code for a specific processor ( -x(target) or -ax(target) ).

report.name: lvl0_profiled_modules
report.text: Application is correctly profiled ("Others" category represents 0.02 % of the execution time)
report.desc: To have a representative profiling, it is advised that the category "Others" represents less than 20% of the execution time in order to analyze as much as possible of the user code

report.name: lvl0_is_lstopo
report.text: Lstopo present. The Topology lstopo report will be generated.
